Exercise

Decide which of the following pairs of events (\(A\) and \(B\)) arising from the experiments described are independent.

  1. One card is drawn from each of two packs.
    \(A=\) a red card is drawn from pack \(1\).
    \(B=\) a picture card is drawn from pack \(2\).
    \(A\) and \(B\) are [[1]]
  2. The daily traffic accidents in Hull involving pedal cyclists and motorcyclists are counted.
    \(A=\) three motor cyclists are injured in separate collisions with cars.
    \(B=\) one pedal cyclist is injured when hit by a bus.
    \(A\) and \(B\) are [[1]]
  3. Two boxes contains 20 nuts each, some have a metric thread, some have a British Standard Fine (BSF) threads and some have a British Standard Whitworth (BSW) thread. A nut is picked out of each box.
    \(A=\) a nut picked out of the first box is BSF.
    \(B=\) a nut picked out of the second box is metric.
    \(A\) and \(B\) are [[1]]
  4. A box contains 20 nuts, some have a metric thread, some have a British Standard Fine (BSF) threads and some have British Standard Whitworth (BSW) thread. Two nuts are picked out of the box.
    \(A=\) first nut picked out of the box is BSF.
    \(B=\) second nut picked out of the box is metric.
    \(A\) and \(B\) are [[2]]
